intro: Geissanthus abditus, commonly known as the hidden geissanthus, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
